Pre-Game Insights: Germany is heavily favored to win at home.
Scotland is the longshot in the group, with the longest odds to win the group (+1000) and to advance (-110).
This isn't exactly starting the tournament with a marquee match, but Scotland is a good embodiment of the expanded Euro field.
Germany hasn’t played a competitive match since the shocking group stage exit at the 2022 World Cup.
Toni Kroos is retiring after the tournament and has never won the Euros despite winning everything else in his career.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Germans have much higher expectations and anything other than a win on Friday would send alarm bells ringing.
In the interim, Germany has six wins, three draws and six defeats in friendlies.
That’s a big drop off from the run from 2002-2016, which saw the Germans make at least the semifinals in seven of eight major tournaments.
